comments:
I tried to create a new Plug-in-Project using the code generation wizard "Plug-
in with a view", with all options left to default.

Everything seems to be fine with the plugin.xml, but the View class 
("SampleView" in package "views") isn't created at all.

If you are starting with a clean workspace, go to 'Plug-in Development-
>TargetPlatform' preferences and enable all external plug-ins. Also enable 
autobuild (on by default). Let me know if that helps.

If I try to "Select All", then "Apply" or "OK" on the "Target Platform" - page, 
the following internal error is spawned : 

java.lang.NullPointerException

From now on the plug-ins seem to remain checked, but that won't help.

I also tried the code generation wizard after having imported all external Plug-
ins as projects into my workspace.

I also see the exception (the problem will be fixed in tomorrow's follow-up 
build). However, the exception does not affect the behaviour (the plug-ins get 
checked). When I use the wizard to create the plug-in, everything works well 
and the class is created. Could you specify the exact set of steps and your 
settings?

"Clean" installation in D:\eclipse-SDK-20020402-win32\eclipse.
Start Eclipse, goto "Target Platform" in Plug-in Dev. - Preferences,
Select All, OK (Exception occurs).

Then I create a new Plug-in Project 
New Plug-in Project > Name "test" > (leave defaults) > create a new plug-in 
using a code generation wizard, select "Plug-in with a view" > (leave defaults) 
> (leave defaults) > (leave defaults) > Finish

Now my Project-Tree looks like this :

test
|-bin
| |-test
|   |-testPlugin.class
|-src
| |-test
|   |-testPlugin.java
|-.classpath
|-.project
|-.template
|-build.properties
|-plugin.xml


The View-extension is (as far as I can see) correctly set in the plugin.xml :
<extension
         point="org.eclipse.ui.views">
      <category
            name="Sample Category"
            id="test">
      </category>
      <view
            name="Sample View"
            icon="icons/sample.gif"
            category="test"
            class="test.views.SampleView"
            id="test.views.SampleView">
      </view>
   </extension>

But there's neither a "views" - package, nor a "SampleView.java".

This is  really funny - I have just followed your steps and I can see 'test' 
package with testPlugin.java and also test.views package with SampleView.java. 
I followed your scenario exactly.

OK, there is going to be a build today. Since I am using a slightly newer 
version of code with the fix for NPE you are experiencing, wait for the build 
and try it again. I see no problems on my end.

Hmm.. I'm now working on the latest integration build (20020404), but the 
problem persists. I also tried other selections, e.g. create a "New File 
Wizard" Plug-in with the "[...] selectable list of templates".
But no matter which templates I select, the created output is always the same 
as if I had "Deselect all" > "Finish". 

I noticed some strange behaviour in the Wizard, which *might* have to do 
something with this, but I'm in doubt if this belongs together :

(we are in the "Plug-in Code Generators" - page of the wizard)

1.)I select the radiobutton "with code generation template", select one of the 
available wizards, then "Next >" and immediately "< Back".
Now the radio-selection has changed to "empty plug-in", the wizards-list is 
grayed (but has still a blue bar on my selection), and the "Next >" Button is 
*enabled* (which shouldn't be) but without function.

2.) If I select the "with selectable list of templates" - wizard, "Next 
>", "Next >", then select *only* the topmost template ("Sample Action Set"), 
*ALL* templates are sequentially processed (that means the wizard works on as 
if I had done "Select All")

This affects only the topmost template, other templates are correctly combined.

Found it - I forgot to include directory 'templates/' in build.properties of 
PDE UI plug-in. As a result, PDE could not find parametrized template files and 
could not generate workspace file from them. A fairly lame mistake but easy to 
correct.
